abstract: The most efficient known construction of equation automaton is that due to Ziadi and Champarnaud. It requires O(| E|2) time and space and is based on going from position automaton to equation automaton using c-continuations. This complexity is due to the sorting step that takes O(| E|2) time used to identify the identical sub-expressions of E. In this paper, we presente a more efficient construction of th e equation automaton which avoids the sorting step and replaces it by a minimization of an acyclic finite determinis tic automaton. We show that this minimization allows the identification of identical sub-expression as well as the so rting step used in Champarnaud and Ziadi approach. Using the minimization we get O(| E| + | E| Â· |EE|) time and space complexity where |EE| is the number of states of the equation automaton.
